citation.article-title: Microterricola viridarii gen. nov., sp. nov., a new member of the family Microbacteriaceae.
citation.source: International Journal of Systematic and Evolutionary Microbiology

p.s: Microterricola (Mic.ro.ter′ri.co.la. Gr. adj. micros small; L. fem. n. terricola dweller in soil; L. fem. n. Microterricola a small dweller in soil).
Cells are Gram-positive, catalase-positive, aerobic and motile.
The cell-wall peptidoglycan contains DAB, glycine, alanine and glutamic acid.
Predominant menaquinone is MK-12 and minor menaquinones are MK-11 and MK-13.
Predominant cellular fatty acids are anteiso-branched (anteiso-15 : 0, anteiso-17 : 0).
The type species is Microterricola viridarii.
